data.title: Good Latin cuisine in the south suburbs
data.text: Wanted some Latin American fare for a while and this place hit the spot. Yuca, plantain, tostones, arepas were all good. Wings, shrimp and calamari had good sauces. The pernil asado (pork shoulder) very good with yuca, tostones, slaw and orange rice which was new to me. Rice wth Souza seasoning. The chips are very good also. Good mixture of chips. Salsa was spicy and fresh. You have option to order tapas (good sizes) or a main dish (large enough for 2). Tapas allow you to try more. Place is spacious with indoor and outdoor seating. It's also a bar so I assume busier on weekends. Restaurant opens at 3pm each day except Sat and Sun at 12. We dined on a late Sunday afternoon. Had the place to ourselves. Good Spanish food. Must visit.

data.title: Love the atmosphere
data.text: I go to el coco mio with family most of the time. My uncle used to play with a band. The set up is very different. The bar lounge is very nice. It's a huge location, but I have yet to see it filled, however, I have only gone a few times. I enjoy the food, but I am unfamiliar with some of the dishes, so I tried appetizers and they are very good. I would go back.

data.title: Good chips & drinks!
data.text: We had groupon and even with that we went well over $50. High prices for alright food. I liked the margarita though! And the chips they give when arriving are so good. So I'd definitely go back for margaritas and chips just not dinner.

data.title: Very good Latin food.
data.text: Thank you, Groupon, or we would not have found this place. The menu is quite unique with Latin specialties prepared very well. The shrimp appetizer was great with three jumbo shrimp,  sauteed radicchio and plantains in a coconut cream sauce. Not too sweet or heavy, it was delicious. The lamb shank fell off the bone. Veggie chips with fresh salsa and green adobe were a great start. Large restaurant with DJs on the week-end, it is a bright star right across from the train station. Lots of free parking nearby.

data.title: What has happened?
data.text:
This is a FYI about this restaurant. We have visited in the past and had great experiences.  Decided to try another visit in October  and again on January 7. Both times I had verified that the restaurant would be open the intended  days.  We showed up on our days off work and the place was closed up tight. We sat in the parking lot for 1 hour each time, having been told both times by staff from Isabella's, another restaurant in town  owned by the same person, that the restaurant  should be opened that day at 3 pm...it was now  after 4.
We have now lost 2 Groupon deals on them.
Today I reached a female  staff person who told me that there was nothing they could do about the Groupon  and she could not get there to open.  Why didn't I try another day. She ended her very rude  retort with if you want to talk to someone else call back after 9pm, maybe Carlos would be around. 
This is   very  different treatment  from the past. Would  recommend not visiting unless you are very sure someone is there.  Hopefully this rude employee will no longer be on staff here. It is too bad management is not  supervising  staff at this  location.

data.title: Good food....great service
data.text:
I've eaten at El Coco Mio twice in the last month with my family and both times we've had rave reviews. We've had many items off the menu, from the Empanadas, to the Coco's Pizza, the Arepa (these are outstanding), and the Estofado, and everything has been delicious. The  Sangria is really good, and I'm a huge fan of the Monkey La La. In fact, you could say that I'm La-La over this drink! 

We've dined in the bar area and also eaten in the regular seating area and have enjoyed both experiences. The atmosphere is casual, and the prices are mid-range.

data.title: Great food, Great price
data.text:
El Coco Mio always surprises us every time we visit. We order 2-3 orders more than the people in our party and share. Every thing that we have tried has been good. The service is good and there has never been a wait. 
This is an undiscovered jewel that needs to shared with all. We always order until we are content and the cost is ALWAYS extremely reasonable. Be sure that you get the free chips and salsas that are not to be missed. Very unusual chips and very tasty different salsas. We've been several times and look forward to going back every time.

data.title: Food was good but...
data.text: I wanted to love this place, but I did not. It was solidly ok. I enjoyed my watermelon mojito and empanadas. I had the lamb shank and husband had the ox tails both were tender but was only ok. We had the flan for dessert it was a little too sweet for me but still good. This is local for us so we would go back and try something different.

data.title: latin restaurant with interesting menu  choices
data.text: Went for dinner and tried the tapas option. Fried calamari was very tender but a little greasy.  Ceviche portion generous. Chile relleno was very good. Disappointed with the traditional margaritas. The restaurants version of tiramisu was confusing as there was absolutely no relation to tiramisu. Was hoping to try the flan but they were out

data.title: Excellent latin food and ambiance! Very authentic latin food!
data.text: I am originally from Tinley Park but now live in Orlando, FL.  Some of my friends there told me about this place and that one of the owners is from Honduras where I'm in the process of adopting a child from so they said that I need to try this place upon my next visit back home.  I went there one night last April and so was impressed with everything!!!  The entire staff was so warm and helpful, service and food were both outstanding!!!  I look forward to bringing my future daughter here to experience this wonderful restaurant!!

data.title: New Adventure!
data.text: We were going out and talked about how we wanted to have tacos tonight but didn't want to go to downtown Chicago and guess what we found one in Tinley Park. This will be a live review as we are eating there right now. Service was quick and friendly. Tapas were nice but the one we one we wanted they were out of. Tapa menu is a little limited but what we had was tasty. Rice pudding for dessert was nice not what we expected but still very good

data.title: Incredible Spanish food
data.text:
My husband, son and I dined at El Coco Mio tonight and had some delicious tapas.  We started out with complimentary yucca chips and pico de gallo (salsa) which were addicting.  Our wonderful waitress, Ginger, recommended the scallops and tacquitos, which we ordered, along with ceviche, fried calamari, and chicken wings.  Of course, all of these dishes are listed on the menu with their correct Spanish names,  We also enjoyed $5 Sangria and margaritas, which were tastier than the drinks we paid big money for when we were in downtown Chicago last weekend.
All of the dishes that we tried were exceptional and reminded us of our last trip to Spain.  The prices were quite reasonable for the high quality of food and friendly, helpful service that we experienced.  We will definitely be back.

data.title: A great restaurant in Tinley Park
data.text: What a great find!  If it had not been for Groupon we would not have found this gem.  The selection on the menu is fantastic!  Monday through Thursday they offer $5 margaritas, mojitos, and sangrias.  The ox tail stew was great--not really a stew--more like braised ox tail but it was really great!  The ceviche was outstanding as was the Ensalada Grileada (seasonal mix grilled vegetables, over mixed greens with mango vinaigrette).  The restaurant was quiet (Wednesday evening)--they do have live music on weekends.  Prices are reasonable.  Don't expect Mexican food-- this is Latin food.  We will definitely be going back!!

data.title: Unique Tapas !
data.text:
We ordered the Polenta soup, excellent flavor, chef's mother's recipe, would order again!
Ordered 4 Tapas, all well prepared and a good portion. Enough for 2 to share each plate. 
Cerviche is excellent! As well as the Mussels and Enchiladas. We will be back!

data.title: Great find in the neighborhood
data.text:
Wonderful new place to  relax and enjoy! 
Food is great. Tapas or full  entree. ..or mix. Portions  are good  size  for  sharing.  Service is friendly and helpful. Drink  specials  every night.  If you like  late  evenings,  a bar with  live  entertainment. 
Will be back!

data.title: Good food and selections
data.text: We went here because I had a Groupon. At 5:30 on a Saturday the place was dead. That kind of worried us. The guy who seated us was smug, but the waitress was excellent. She found out it was our first time and went over the whole menu in 2 minutes. We started off with a couple Caribeno drinks. They were pretty strong (no skimping there). Then we had 3 tapas plates pupusas, pan seared scallops in a coconut sauce and arepa. Everything was delicious, especially the coconut chile lime sauce on the scallops. Then we shared the duck with almonds and mole and the beef tenderloin stuffed with chorizo. We had some leftovers to take home. For dessert we had the tres keches cake. It was simple but delicious. The food was great and our overall experience was good. The waitress made it fun.  We will definitely visit again.

data.title: Great food but identity crisis!
data.text: To start, the food was amazing! All the tapas dishes were well prepared and served.  The tastes and portions were incredible.  Even the chips and salsa were a very unique and tasty experience.  Service was fantastic and friendly.  This place would have an unquestioned 5 stars if not for one significant and troubling problem... The place isn't sure if it wants to be a nice tapas restaurant, a casino, or a late night dance club.  I vote for tapas place but unless they figure that out for themselves, real serious restaurant goers may pass on this wonderful place because it appears to not be what it should be.  Judging in the turnout at the casino and nightclub this past Saturday night, it seems that focusing on the restaurant would be the more profitable idea.

data.title: EXCELLENT!!!
data.text: The food was outstanding- everything is made there. Fresh and delicious -you have to even just stop in for a drink and try their homemade vegetable chips and pico de gallo.  Outstanding!!!  We ordered several tappas and each was distinct, fresh and delicious.   I am looking forward to returning.  Prices are average and there is parking right behind the restaurant.

data.title: Good Tapas, but the Experience Needs Work.
data.text: Three of us went there on a Groupon. My first impressions was that the place looked and felt like a funeral home.  It was dark, only 2 or 3 tables filled and very quiet. The entry dining room could use some festive decor. The host was also our server. We waited a little to get some water. Our server stated that the restaurant had been open for over a year. We put in our drink order but did not receive them for some time apparently due to a printer glitch according to our server.  The people at the next table were apparently not familiar with the tapas concept and went away very dissatisfied, but our experience with the food was different.  We enjoyed an array of 5 or 6 tapas dishes along with the veggie chips and delicious salsa.  Ceviche was outstanding. Bottom line is that the food was good, but some of the dishes could have been warmer. The service was off.  I don't know, maybe they were shorthanded.  It's worth another shot I think.  Please note:  If you're expecting Mexican cuisine and not open to an array of new Central American, South American and Caribbean flavors, then go somewhere else.

data.title: A Great Tinley Experience
data.text: We have been to El Coco Mio a number of times and have never been disappointed. A rich menu not to be found in your typical Mexican restaurant. Highly recommended.
